Content:: This article consists of various statistical charts related to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic in Serbia. Growth factor is defined as today's new cases/new cases on the previous day.[1] It is indicative of the evolution of the pandemic. A continuously decreasing factor indicates that the pandemic is under control. From June 6 until July 15, official source[2] stopped giving number of hospitalized patients, only number of active ones From 6 June to 15 July this chart shows number of active cases.  Sudden jump in number of recoveries since 6 June was explained by changed methodology of determining healthy patients, requiring only one negative COVID-19 PCR test, as opposed to two negative test at least 24 hours apart required before.[3]       (*) – include only Serbian communities in Kosovo [a][6]     Data acquired from the official website.[7]
Title: Statistics of the COVID-19 pandemic in Serbia - Wikipedia
